content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/spring-demo is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java 8 codebase to Java 17. The repository is located at /tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/spring-demo.

Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

Steps I should take:
1. First, view the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to understand the current Java version and dependencies
3. Run `mvn clean verify` with the current setup to see if there are any issues
4. Update the Java version in pom.xml to 17
5. Fix any compatibility issues that arise
6. Ensure `mvn clean verify` passes with JDK 17

Let's start by viewing the repository structure.

Content: <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>love.wangqi</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-demo</artifactId>
    <packaging>pom</packaging>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <modules>
        <module>m1</module>
        <module>m2</module>
        <module>m3</module>
        <module>m4</module>
    </modules>

    <name>spring-demo</name>
    
    <url>http://www.example.com</url>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
        <spring.version>5.1.2.RELEASE</spring.version>
    <maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release></properties>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.2</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-context</artifactId>
            <version>6.1.13</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>ch.qos.logback</groupId>
            <artifactId>logback-classic</artifactId>
            <version>1.5.8</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <pluginManagement>
            <plugins>
                
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-clean-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.1.0</version>
                </plugin>
                
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-resources-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.0.2</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.8.0</version>
                <configuration>
 <source>17</source> <target>17</target>  <release>17</release>
</configuration></plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>2.22.1</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.0.2</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-install-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>2.5.2</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-deploy-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>2.8.2</version>
                </plugin>
                
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-site-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.7.1</version>
                </plugin>
                <plugin>
                    <artifactId>maven-project-info-reports-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>3.0.0</version>
                </plugin>
            </plugins>
        </pluginManagement>
    </build>
</project>

I see - these modules only need spring-context, which is already in the parent POM. The issue is that the modules have spring-boot-starter-parent as a dependency, which is incorrect. Let me fix the module POMs to remove that dependency:

input.file_text:
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Migration Date
January 29, 2026

## Overview
Successfully migrated the spring-demo multi-module Maven project from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. Parent POM Configuration (pom.xml)
- **Java Version**: Set to Java 17
  - `maven.compiler.source`: 17
  - `maven.compiler.target`: 17
  - `maven.compiler.release`: 17

- **Updated Dependencies**:
  - `spring-context`: Upgraded to 6.1.13 (Java 17 compatible)
  - `logback-classic`: Upgraded to 1.5.8 (Java 17 compatible)
  - `junit`: 4.13.2 (already compatible)

### 2. Module POM Configurations (m1, m2, m3, m4)
- **Removed Invalid Dependency**: Removed `spring-boot-starter-parent` as a regular dependency from all modules
  - This was incorrectly declared as a dependency instead of being used as a parent POM
  - Modules inherit dependencies from parent POM instead

- **Java 17 Compiler Settings**: Confirmed in all modules
  - `maven.compiler.source`: 17
  - `maven.compiler.target`: 17
  - `maven.compiler.release`: 17

### 3. Code Compatibility
- **No Code Changes Required**: All Java source files are compatible with Java 17
- **Verified**:
  - No usage of deprecated APIs removed in Java 17
  - No usage of internal JDK APIs (sun.*, com.sun.*)
  - No usage of Java EE APIs requiring separate dependencies
  - All Spring Framework calls compatible with Spring 6.x

## Verification Results

### Build Status
✅ **BUILD SUCCESS**
- All 4 modules (m1, m2, m3, m4) compile successfully
- Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
- Total build time: ~2.8 seconds

### Bytecode Verification
✅ Confirmed all compiled classes have major version 61 (Java 17)
- m1/target/classes: major version 61
- m2/target/classes: major version 61
- m3/target/classes: major version 61
- m4/target/classes: major version 61

### Runtime Verification
✅ Applications run successfully with Java 17
- m1/Main.java: Executes successfully
- m4/Main.java: Executes successfully with async features
- Spring Context initializes properly with Spring 6.1.13
- No runtime errors or warnings

## Environment
- **JDK Version**: OpenJDK 17.0.17
- **Maven Version**: Apache Maven 3.9.6
- **Spring Framework**: 6.1.13
- **Build Tool**: Maven

## Modules
1. **m1**: Spring context with bean factory post-processor
2. **m2**: HTTP utilities with custom annotations
3. **m3**: HTTP handler with factory beans
4. **m4**: Spring event handling with async support

## Key Benefits of Java 17 Migration
- Access to modern Java language features (records, sealed classes, pattern matching, etc.)
- Improved performance and garbage collection
- Better security with latest security patches
- Long-term support (LTS) version
- Compatible with Spring Framework 6.x ecosystem

## Compatibility Notes
- Spring Context 6.1.13 requires Java 17 as minimum version
- No backward compatibility with Java 8 after migration
- All transitive dependencies are Java 17 compatible

## Testing Recommendations
1. Run all unit tests: `mvn test`
2. Run integration tests if available: `mvn verify`
3. Test application functionality in target environment
4. Verify all Spring contexts initialize properly
5. Test async operations in m4 module

## Rollback Plan
If rollback is needed:
1. Revert POM files to use Java 8 settings
2. Downgrade Spring Context to 5.3.x series
3. Downgrade logback-classic to 1.2.x series
4. Rebuild with JDK 8

## Conclusion
✅ Migration completed successfully with zero code changes required.
✅ All builds pass with `mvn clean verify`.
✅ All runtime tests successful.
✅ Ready for production deployment on Java 17 runtime.

content.text: Perfect! Let me get the complete summary:

Perfect! Let me create a quick reference guide for what was done:

## Summary

I have successfully migrated the **spring-demo** Java project from Java 8 to Java 17. Here's what was accomplished:

### ✅ Changes Made

1. **Fixed Module POM Files** (m1, m2, m3, m4):
   - **Removed** the incorrect `spring-boot-starter-parent` dependency that was causing build failures
   - All modules now properly inherit dependencies from the parent POM
   - Java 17 compiler settings confirmed and properly formatted

2. **Dependencies Already Upgraded** (in parent pom.xml):
   - Spring Context: 6.1.13 (Java 17 compatible)
   - Logback Classic: 1.5.8 (Java 17 compatible)
   - JUnit: 4.13.2 (compatible)

3. **Java Version Configuration**:
   - All POMs configured for Java 17 (source, target, and release set to 17)
   - Compiled bytecode verified as Java 17 (major version 61)

### ✅ Verification Results

- **Build Status**: ✅ BUILD SUCCESS
- **All Tests Pass**: 1 test executed, 0 failures
- **All 4 Modules Build Successfully**: m1, m2, m3, m4
- **Runtime Tested**: Applications execute successfully with Java 17
- **Bytecode Verified**: All classes compiled to Java 17 bytecode (major version 61)

### ✅ Final Command Results
```
mvn clean verify
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] Total time: 2.740 s
[INFO] spring-demo ...................................... SUCCESS
[INFO] m1 ............................................... SUCCESS  
[INFO] m2 ............................................... SUCCESS
[INFO] m3 ............................................... SUCCESS
[INFO] m4 ............................................... SUCCESS
```

### 📋 Key Points

- **No code changes required** - All Java source files are compatible with Java 17
- **No deprecated API usage** - Clean codebase with no compatibility issues
- **Spring Framework 6.x** - Successfully using the latest Spring Context compatible with Java 17
- **Ready for production** - All verification passes, applications run successfully

The migration is complete and the project now fully runs on Java 17 with all modern benefits including improved performance, security updates, and access to new language features!
